field.label: Enabled
field.help: Enable this Autossh tunnel.

field.label: Description
field.help: Free form text field available to describe this connection if required.

field.label: User
field.help: Provide the connection username for this connection.

field.label: Hostname
field.help: Provide the hostname or address to use for this connection.

field.label: Port
field.help: Provide the TCP port number, defaults to 22 if not provided.

field.label: SSH key name
field.help: Select the SSH key by name to use for this connection - this key must be generated prior to creating a ssh-tunnel.

field.label: Strict Host Key Checking
field.help: Sets the ssh-server host key checking behaviour. Refer to StrictHostKeyChecking ssh-client option.

field.label: Bind Interface
field.help: Select the interface to bind and originate this SSH connection from.

field.label: Local Forward
field.help: The local port forward definition, for example 2222 127.0.0.1:22 would make the remote system TCP22 available at TCP2222 on this system at 127.0.0.1. Leave empty for no local forwarding. Refer to LocalForward ssh-client option.

field.label: Remote Forward
field.help: The remote port forward definition, for example *:2222 127.0.0.1:22 would allow network users on the remote site to connect to TCP2222 which forwards to TCP22 on this system at 127.0.0.1. Leave empty for no remote forwarding. Refer to RemoteForward ssh-client option.

field.label: Dynamic Forward
field.help: Specifies that a TCP port be forwarded as a SOCKS proxy over the SSH channel, for example *:1080 would allow local network users to use this system as a SOCKS proxy appearing as if at the remote system. Leave empty for no dynamic forwarding. Refer to DynamicForward ssh-client option.

field.label: Gateway Ports
field.help: Specifies whether remote hosts are allowed to connect to local forwarded ports. Refer to GatewayPorts ssh-client option.

field.label: Address Family
field.help: Specifies which address family to use when connecting. Refer to AddressFamily ssh-client option.

field.label: Check Host IP
field.help: If set to yes the ssh-client will additionally check the host IP address in the known_hosts file. Refer to CheckHostIP ssh-client option.

field.label: Ciphers
field.help: Specifies the ciphers allowed and their order of preference. Refer to Ciphers ssh-client option.

field.label: Compression
field.help: Specifies whether to use compression. Refer to Compression ssh-client option.

field.label: Connection Attempts
field.help: Specifies the number of tries (one per second) to make before exiting. Refer to ConnectionAttempts ssh-client option.

field.label: Connect Timeout
field.help: Specifies the timeout (in seconds) used when connecting to the SSH server, instead of using the default system TCP timeout. Refer to ConnectTimeout ssh-client option.

field.label: Host Key Algorithms
field.help: Specifies the host key algorithms that the client wants to use in order of preference. Refer to HostKeyAlgorithms ssh-client option.

field.label: Key Exchange Algorithms
field.help: Specifies the available key exchange (KEX) algorithms. Refer to KeyExchangeAlgorithms ssh-client option.

field.label: Log Level
field.help: Gives the verbosity level that is used when logging messages from ssh. Refer to LogLevel ssh-client option.

field.label: MACs
field.help: Specifies the MAC (message authentication code) algorithms in order of preference. Refer to MACs ssh-client option.

field.label: Pubkey Accepted Key Types
field.help: Specifies the key types that will be used for public key authentication. Refer to PubkeyAcceptedKeyTypes ssh-client option.

field.label: Rekey Limit
field.help: Specifies the maximum amount of time or data before the session key is renegotiated. Refer to RekeyLimit ssh-client option.

field.label: Server Alive Count Max
field.help: Sets the number of server alive messages which may be sent without the ssh-client receiving any messages back from the server. Refer to ServerAliveCountMax ssh-client option.

field.label: Server Alive Interval
field.help: Sets a timeout interval in seconds after which if no data has been received from the server, ssh will send a message through the encrypted channel to request a response from the server. Refer to ServerAliveInterval ssh-client option.

field.label: TCP Keep Alive
field.help: Specifies whether the system should send TCP keepalive messages to the other side. Refer to TCPKeepAlive ssh-client option.

field.label: Update Host Keys
field.help: Specifies whether ssh-client should accept notifications of additional hostkeys from the server sent after authentication has completed. Refer to UpdateHostKeys ssh-client option.

field.label: Verify Host Key DNS
field.help: Specifies whether to verify the remote key using DNSSEC and SSHFP resource records. Refer to VerifyHostKeyDNS ssh-client option.
